formalpara.title: Summary
formalpara.para: The Red Hat Enterprise Virtualization Manager makes use of sudo to perform operations as the root on the host. The default Red Hat Enterprise Linux configuration, stored in /etc/sudoers, contains values that allow this. If this file has been modified since Red Had Enterprise Linux installation these values may have been removed. This procedure provides steps to verify that the required entry still exists in the configuration, and add it if it does not.

step.title: Log in
step.para: Log in to the virtualization host as the root user.

step.title: Run visudo
step.para: Run the visudo command to open the /etc/sudoers

step.title: Edit sudoers file
step.para: Read the configuration file, and verify that it contains these lines:
step.screen: # Allow root to run any commands anywhere root ALL=(ALL) ALL
step.para: If the file does not contain these lines, add them and save the file using the VIM :w command.

step.title: Exit editor
step.para: Exit visudo using the VIM :q command.

formalpara.title: Result
formalpara.para: You have configured sudo to allow use by the root user.
